data.title: South Korea arrests ex-defense minister over martial law, Yonhap News says
data.description: SEOUL: South Korean prosecutors on Sunday arrested ex-Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun over his alleged role in President Yoon Suk Yeol

data.title: Syrian rebels advancing rapidly
data.description: Syrian rebels pressed their lightning advance on Saturday, saying they had seized most of the south, as government forces dug in to defend the key central city of Homs to try to save President Bashar al-Assad’s 24-year rule.

data.title: Embattled Korean president dodges impeachment
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea’s main opposition Democratic Party said it would not give up its attempt to  impeach  President  Yoon Suk Yeol  after losing a parliamentary vote late on Saturday.

data.title: Embattled Korean president might dodge impeachment
data.description: SEOUL - A motion to  impeach  South Korean President  Yoon Suk Yeol  was on the brink of failing on Saturday, after lawmakers from his ruling party boycotted the ballot despite huge protests outside parliament.

data.title: Trump returns to world stage at Notre-Dame reopening
data.description: PARIS - US President-elect Donald Trump returns to the world stage on Saturday to join leaders for the reopening of Notre-Dame Cathedral in Paris, still a private citizen but already preparing to tackle a host of international crises.

data.title: JR East to increase fares by 7%
data.description: TOKYO — East Japan Railway Company said Friday it has applied to the transport ministry to raise its train fares by an average 7.1% beginning March 2026, its first blanket fare hike since the company

data.title: South Korea’s President apologises, but doesn’t resign before impeachment vote
data.description: SEOUL — South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on Saturday apologised to the public for the declaration of martial law this week that has set off widespread protests and thrust the country into political turmoil.

data.title: Police scour New York for killer of insurance CEO
data.description: NEW YORK - Armed with a growing file of clues, New York police on Friday were scouring surveillance videos and asking the public for help in finding the masked assailant who gunned down an executive of America’s biggest health insurer on a Manhattan sidewalk.

data.title: Korean special forces chief defied order to seize lawmakers
data.description: The head of the South Korean Army Special Forces said he defied an order from the defence minister to drag lawmakers out of the National Assembly to enforce  martial law  declared by President  Yoon Suk Yeol  earlier this week.

data.title: Indonesia ready to send former death-row convict to Philippines
data.description: Indonesia and the Philippines signed an agreement on Friday on the repatriation of a Philippine woman who was sentenced to death for drug trafficking, an Indonesian government minister said.

data.title: What is mystery 'Disease X' and why have dozens died in DR Congo?
data.description: HONG KONG — Health officials in the Democratic Republic of the Congo expect to know within days the cause of an infectious disease outbreak termed

data.title: Schiphol airport cancels hundreds of flights due to Storm Darragh
data.description: AMSTERDAM - The Netherlands

data.title: Hong Kong tightens airport health checks amid DR Congo mystery disease outbreak
data.description: Hong Kong authorities have stepped up health screening measures for all flights arriving from African transit hubs as they brace for risks of an unidentified disease that killed at least 79 in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).

data.title: Australia police search for suspects over arson attack on synagogue
data.description: SYDNEY — Australian police said on Friday they were looking for two people suspected of deliberately starting a fire at a Melbourne synagogue that injured one and caused widespread damage.

data.title: US, Japan, Philippine conduct maritime exercises in South China Sea
data.description: MANILA — The armed forces of the Philippines, United States and Japan on Friday conducted a "maritime cooperative activity" within the Manila

data.title: S.Korea's main opposition party says lawmakers on high alert after reports of another martial law declaration, Yonhap reports
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea

data.title: Malaysian ex-PM Najib renews home detention bid
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - Jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak on Thursday mounted a fresh legal bid to serve his remaining prison sentence under house arrest, though court proceedings were cut short to allow prosecutors time to review new evidence.

data.title: Korean president faces impeachment vote on Saturday
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean opposition lawmakers said on Thursday they would vote this weekend to impeach President  Yoon Suk Yeol  over his botched attempt to impose  martial law , while the defence minister blamed for advising the move resigned.

data.title: Chinese researchers tout ‘invisibility’ breakthrough
data.description: BEIJING - Chinese researchers say they have developed a material that quickly changes colour at a molecular level based on the surrounding light, creating a new form of camouflage that could help people blend into their environments — much like a chameleon.

data.title: Criminal probe sought against Malaysian ex-PM Mahathir
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - A Malaysian royal commission studying cases involving three disputed islets in the Singapore Strait has proposed a criminal investigation against former prime minister Mahathir Mohamad, the state news agency Bernama reported on Thursday.

data.title: How a country’s economy was looted dry by politicians
data.description: DHAKA - The new governor of Bangladesh’s central bank, Ahsan Mansur, calculates that about US$17 billion was looted from the country’s financial system by politicians in the 15 years before the government of Sheikh Hasina collapsed in August.

data.title: Calls grow for South Korean president to quit
data.description: SEOUL — South Korean lawmakers on Wednesday proposed impeaching President Yoon Suk Yeol for his sudden decision to declare martial law, which he rescinded after a chaotic standoff between parliament and the army that damaged the country’s standing.

data.title: CEO fatally shot outside New York hotel
data.description: The chief executive of one of America’s largest health insurers was fatally shot outside a hotel in New York City hotel on Wednesday morning, the New York Police Department said.

data.title: ‘Classified’ data suggest huge Russian losses in Ukraine
data.description: LONDON - Forty-eight thousand relatives of Russian troops have submitted DNA samples, a government minister has been recorded as saying, in a sensitive discussion apparently referring to attempts to identify dead soldiers by their remains.

data.title: How a country’s economy was looted dry by politicans
data.description: DHAKA - The new governor of Bangladesh’s central bank, Ahsan Mansur, calculates that about US$17 billion was looted from the country’s financial system by politicians in the 15 years before the government of Sheikh Hasina collapsed in August.

data.title: Philippine ship 'deliberately rammed' Chinese vessel, says China
data.description: BEIJING — China Coast Guard said on Wednesday an official Philippine ship in waters around Scarborough Shoal "ignored" its repeated warnings, and "deliberately rammed" and "seriously threatened" the safety of one of its vessels.

data.title: Headline inflation up 0.95%, below forecast
data.description: The headline consumer price index (CPI) rose 0.95% in November from a year earlier, after the previous month

data.title: S.Korea's Yoon faces impeachment over short-lived martial law declaration
data.description: SEOUL - South Korean lawmakers on Wednesday called for the impeachment of President Yoon Suk Yeol after he declared martial law only to reverse the move hours later, triggering the biggest political crisis in decades in Asia

data.title: South Korea’s Yoon lifts martial law after political gamble
data.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said he will rescind his martial law decree, giving in to the parliament’s opposition just hours after his dramatic move imposing it that shook markets and surprised other world leaders.

data.title: South Korean president declares martial law
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea’s president has declared emergency martial law in the country, accusing opposition forces of anti-state activities.

data.title: European police crack criminals’ messaging service
data.description: AMSTERDAM - An encrypted messaging service that was used for international drug and arms trafficking has been taken down by European authorities, Europol said on Tuesday.

data.title: China bans exports of gallium, germanium, antimony to US
data.description: BEIJING — China will ban exports of "dual-use items" related to gallium, germanium, antimony and superhard materials to the United States with immediate effect, its commerce ministry said on Tuesday, a day after Washington

data.title: Vietnam court upholds property tycoon’s death sentence
data.description: A court in Vietnam has upheld a  death sentence  against the property tycoon Truong My Lan but said her life could be spared if she returns three-quarters of the $12 billion she embezzled.

data.title: The best and worst places for expats to live now
data.description: After a turbulent year, with headlines dominated by divisive politics, war and trepidation over the future, is it time to make that move you have always dreamed about? If so, the question is, where next?

data.title: Malaysians return to devastated homes as floodwaters recede
data.description: TUMPAT, Malaysia - Residents in the Malaysian town of Tumpat were returning to submerged homes and shops as deadly floodwaters eased in some areas following the worst floods in decades over the weekend, and more heavy rain was forecast as soon as Tuesday.

data.title: Philippines sends ships to reef after China ‘harassment’
data.description: The Philippines said a Chinese Navy chopper harassed Filipino fishing boats at a disputed South China Sea reef, showing lingering tensions in the key waterway.

data.title: Taxing farm animals’ farts and burps? Denmark gives it a try.
data.description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark — Denmark, known for its inventive restaurants and elegant design studios, is about to become known for something more basic: the world’s first belch and manure tax.

data.title: Last marine heat wave providing lessons for the future
data.description: SAN FRANCISCO — They call it “the Blob". A decade ago, sea surface temperatures in the Pacific soared 11 degrees Celsius above normal.

data.title: Biden says he is pardoning his son, Hunter
data.description: WASHINGTON: US President Joe Biden said on Sunday he had pardoned his son, Hunter Biden.
